title: Gimhani out, Fernando in
byline: The prestigious Asian Under 22 and Youth Men’s and Women’s Boxing Championship, set to be hosted in Sri Lanka from May 12 to 23 at the Sugathadasa Indoor Stadium, has been marred by growing concerns over the transparency and fairness of the national selection process.

title: NPP warns of non-allocation of funds for local bodies controlled by Opposition
byline: Samagi Jana Balawegaya (SJB) MP Rohini Kaviratne in a letter addressed to Secretary Election Commission and Assistant Commissioner Matale District has lodged a complaint against a leaflet that has been distributed by the ruling National People’s Power (NPP) which indicates that funds for the local bodies which will be secured by the opposition at the Local Government polls will be blocked.

title: Reshan Swings to Glory
byline: At just 17 years old, Reshan Algama stands as one of Sri Lanka’s top-ranked amateur golfers on the World Amateur Golf Ranking (WAGR) - and now, he carries the pride of his country into the Grand Final of the prestigious Nick Faldo Series Asia, after receiving a wildcard.

title: Gujarat Titans announce replacement of injured Glenn Phillips in squad
byline: Gujarat Titans have picked Sri Lanka all-rounder Dasun Shanaka as a replacement for injured Glenn Phillips in their squad for the rest of the ongoing Indian Premier League (IPL) season.

title: Health authorities slammed for turning blind eye to Chikungunya surge
byline: Health authorities are under fire for failing to issue relevant guidelines to contain Chikungunya in light of its rapid rise across the country.

title: Earth slips block Beragala–Wellawaya road
byline: Traffic on the Beragala–Wellawaya road has been obstructed due to earth slips in the Viharagala area (at the 184 km post), the Disaster Management Centre said.

title: Shooting at Manampitiya Christ Church, suspect arrested
byline: The suspect who opened fire at the ’Living Christ Church’ at Ayurveda Place, Manampitiya and fled has been arrested by the police.

title: President offering bribes to voters is regrettable: Sumanthiran
byline: General Secretary of the Ilankai Tamil Arachu Katchi (ITAK) M.A. Sumanthiran said it is highly regrettable that President Anura Kumara Dissanayake has chosen to repeatedly offer bribes to voters by stating that funds will be more easily allocated to councils governed by the ruling National People’s Power (NPP)  and not to others.

title: President denies saying no funds will be allocated for local bodies controlled by Opposition
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake said today he never said no funds will be allocated for local bodies that are not controlled by the National People’s Power (NPP) as claimed  by some people.

title: Three businesswomen nabbed with Kush at BIA
byline: Three businesswomen were arrested this morning at the Bandaranaike International Airport (BIA) while attempting to smuggle in a stock of ‘Kush’ valued at over Rs. 629 million.

title: Man killed in wild elephant attack
byline: A 44-year-old man was killed in a wild elephant attack in Horowpathana early this morning.
